# aperture

**Instance Property**

A factor that determines the transition between in-focus and out-of-focus areas. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var aperture: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

Objects at distances from the camera outside its depth of field (specified by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/focalDistance] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/focalSize] properties) appear increasingly blurred (up to the value of the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/focalBlurRadius] property). Aperture controls the abruptness of the transition between sharp and blurred—a low value specifies an abrupt transition, and a higher value specifies a gradual transition. The default aperture is `0.125` (or 1/8).

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Deprecated

- **yFov**: The camera’s field of view, in degrees, on the vertical axis. Animatable.
- **xFov**: The camera’s field of view, in degrees, on the horizontal axis. Animatable.
- **focalDistance**: The distance from the camera at which objects appear in sharp focus. Animatable.
- **focalSize**: The width of the distance range at which objects appear in sharp focus. Animatable.
- **focalBlurRadius**: The maximum amount of blurring, in pixels, applied to areas outside the camera’s depth of field. Animatable.
